name: NSFontFamilyClass
desc: Constants that classify certain stylistic qualities of the font.

items.name: var NSFontUnknownClass: Int
items.desc: A font with no design classification.

items.name: var NSFontOldStyleSerifsClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style is based on the Latin printing style of the 15th to 17th century.

items.name: var NSFontTransitionalSerifsClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style is based on the Latin printing style of the 18th to 19th century.

items.name: var NSFontModernSerifsClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style is based on the Latin printing style of the 20th century.

items.name: var NSFontClarendonSerifsClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style is a variation of the Oldstyle Serifs and the Transitional Serifs.

items.name: var NSFontSlabSerifsClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style is characterized by serifs with a square transition between the strokes and the serifs (no brackets).

items.name: var NSFontFreeformSerifsClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style includes serifs, but it expresses a design freedom that does not generally fit within the other serif design classifications.

items.name: var NSFontSansSerifClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style includes most basic letter forms (excluding Scripts and Ornamentals) that do not have serifs on the strokes.

items.name: var NSFontOrnamentalsClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style includes highly decorated or stylized character shapes such as those typically used in headlines.

items.name: var NSFontScriptsClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style is among those typefaces designed to simulate handwriting.

items.name: var NSFontSymbolicClass: Int
items.desc: A font where the style is generally design independent, making it suitable for special characters (icons, dingbats, technical symbols, and so on) that may be used equally well with any font.
